slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | इमं विवस्वते योगं प्रोक्तवानहमव्ययम् | विवस्वान्मनवे प्राह मनुरिक्ष्वाकवेऽब्रवीत् ||
slokas.pronunciation:
śrī-bhagavān uvāca
iṁaṁ vivasvate yogaṁ proktavān aham avyayam
vivasvān manave prāha manur ikṣvākave ’bravīt
slokas.meaning: The Blessed Lord said: I taught this eternal science of yoga to the sun-god Vivasvan, who passed it on to Manu, and Manu, in turn, taught it to Ikshvaku.

slokas.sanskrit: एवं परम्पराप्राप्तमिमं राजर्षयो विदुः | स कालेनेह महता योगो नष्टः परन्तप ||
slokas.pronunciation:
evaṁ paramparā-prāptam imaṁ rājarṣayo viduḥ
sa kāleneha mahatā yogo naṣṭaḥ parantapa
slokas.meaning: Thus, this knowledge passed down in a disciplic succession was understood by the royal sages. But over time, this tradition was lost, O Arjuna.

slokas.sanskrit: स एवायं मया तेऽद्य योगः प्रोक्तः पुरातनः | भक्तोऽसि मे सखा चेति रहस्यं ह्येतदुत्तमम् ||
slokas.pronunciation:
sa evāyaṁ mayā te ’dya yogaḥ proktaḥ purātanaḥ
bhakto ’si me sakhā ceti rahasyaṁ hy etad uttamam
slokas.meaning: That same ancient science of yoga has been imparted to you by Me today, because you are My devotee and friend. This is indeed a supreme secret.

slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | अपरं भवतो जन्म परं जन्म विवस्वतः | कथमेतद्विजानीयां त्वमादौ प्रोक्तवानिति ||
slokas.pronunciation:
arjuna uvāca
aparaṁ bhavato janma paraṁ janma vivasvataḥ
katham etad vijānīyāṁ tvam ādau proktavān iti
slokas.meaning: Arjuna said: Your birth is much later, whereas the sun-god Vivasvan's birth is earlier. How then am I to understand that You instructed this yoga in the beginning?

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | बहूनि मे व्यतीतानि जन्मानि तव चार्जुन | तान्यहं वेद सर्वाणि न त्वं वेत्थ परन्तप ||
slokas.pronunciation:
śrī-bhagavān uvāca
bahūni me vyatītāni janmāni tava cārjuna
tāny ahaṁ veda sarvāṇi na tvaṁ vettha parantapa
slokas.meaning: The Blessed Lord said: Many births of Mine and yours have passed, O Arjuna. I know them all, but you do not, O Parantapa.

slokas.sanskrit: अजोऽपि सन्नव्ययात्मा भूतानामीश्वरोऽपि सन् | प्रकृतिं स्वामधिष्ठाय सम्भवाम्यात्ममायया ||
slokas.pronunciation:
ajo ’pi sann avyayātmā bhūtānām īśvaro ’pi san
prakṛtiṁ svām adhiṣṭhāya sambhavāmy ātma-māyayā
slokas.meaning: Though I am unborn, imperishable, and the Lord of all beings, I manifest Myself by controlling My material energy through My divine power.

slokas.sanskrit: यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत | अभ्युत्थानमधर्मस्य तदात्मानं सृजाम्यहम् ||
slokas.pronunciation:
yadā yadā hi dharmasya glānir bhavati bhārata
abhyutthānam adharmasya tad-ātmānaṁ sṛjāmy aham
slokas.meaning: Whenever there is a decline in righteousness and an increase in unrighteousness, O Arjuna, at that time I manifest Myself on earth.

slokas.sanskrit: परित्राणाय साधूनां विनाशाय च दुष्कृताम् | धर्मसंस्थापनार्थाय सम्भवामि युगे युगे ||
slokas.pronunciation:
paritrāṇāya sādhūnāṁ vināśāya ca duṣkṛtām
dharma-saṁsthāpanārthāya sambhavāmi yuge yuge
slokas.meaning: To protect the righteous, annihilate the wicked, and reestablish dharma, I appear in every age.

slokas.sanskrit: जन्म कर्म च मे दिव्यमेवं यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः | त्यक्त्वा देहं पुनर्जन्म नैति मामेति सोऽर्जुन ||
slokas.pronunciation:
janma karma ca me divyam evaṁ yo vetti tattvataḥ
tyaktvā dehaṁ punar janma naiti mām eti so ’rjuna
slokas.meaning: One who knows the divine nature of My birth and actions, upon leaving the body, does not take birth again but attains Me, O Arjuna.

slokas.sanskrit: वीतरागभयक्रोधा मन्मया मामुपाश्रिताः | बहवो ज्ञानतपसा पूता मद्भावमागताः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
vīta-rāga-bhaya-krodhā man-mayā mām upāśritāḥ
bahavo jñāna-tapasā pūtā mad-bhāvam āgatāḥ
slokas.meaning: Freed from attachment, fear, and anger, fully absorbed in Me and taking refuge in Me, many people have purified themselves through knowledge and austerity and attained My divine nature.

slokas.sanskrit: ये यथा मां प्रपद्यन्ते तांस्तथैव भजाम्यहम् | मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्याः पार्थ सर्वशः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
ye yathā māṁ prapadyante tāṁs tathaiva bhajāmy aham
mama vartmānuvartante manuṣyāḥ pārtha sarvaśaḥ
slokas.meaning: As people approach Me, so I reciprocate with them. Everyone follows My path in all respects, O Arjuna.

slokas.sanskrit: काङ्क्षन्तः कर्मणां सिद्धिं यजन्त इह देवताः | क्षिप्रं हि मानुषे लोके सिद्धिर्भवति कर्मजा ||
slokas.pronunciation:
kāṅkṣantaḥ karmaṇāṁ siddhiṁ yajanta iha devatāḥ
kṣipraṁ hi mānuṣe loke siddhir bhavati karma-jā
slokas.meaning: In this world, those desiring success in their actions worship the celestial gods, for success born of actions manifests quickly in the human realm.

slokas.sanskrit: चातुर्वर्ण्यं मया सृष्टं गुणकर्मविभागशः | तस्य कर्तारमपि मां विद्ध्यकर्तारमव्ययम् ||
slokas.pronunciation:
cātur-varṇyaṁ mayā sṛṣṭaṁ guṇa-karma-vibhāgaśaḥ
tasya kartāram api māṁ viddhy akartāram avyayam
slokas.meaning: The four categories of occupations were created by Me according to people's qualities and actions. Although I am the creator of this system, know Me to be the non-doer and eternal.

slokas.sanskrit: न मां कर्माणि लिम्पन्ति न मे कर्मफले स्पृहा | इति मां योऽभिजानाति कर्मभिर्न स बध्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation:
na māṁ karmāṇi limpanti na me karma-phale spṛhā
iti māṁ yo ’bhijānāti karmabhir na sa badhyate
slokas.meaning: Actions do not taint Me, nor do I desire the fruits of actions. One who understands this truth about Me is not bound by karma.

slokas.sanskrit: एवं ज्ञात्वा कृतं कर्म पूर्वैरपि मुमुक्षुभिः | कुरु कर्मैव तस्मात्त्वं पूर्वैः पूर्वतरं कृतम् ||
slokas.pronunciation:
evaṁ jñātvā kṛtaṁ karma pūrvair api mumukṣubhiḥ
kuru karmaiva tasmāt tvaṁ pūrvaiḥ pūrva-taraṁ kṛtam
slokas.meaning: Having known this truth, the ancient seekers of liberation performed actions. Therefore, you too should perform your duties, as the ancients did in earlier times.

slokas.sanskrit: किं कर्म किमकर्मेति कवयोऽप्यत्र मोहिताः | तत्ते कर्म प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात् ||
slokas.pronunciation:
kiṁ karma kim akarmeti kavayo ’py atra mohitāḥ
tat te karma pravakṣyāmi yaj jñātvā mokṣyase ’śubhāt
slokas.meaning: Even the wise are confused about what constitutes action and inaction. Therefore, I shall explain to you what action is, knowing which you shall be freed from all inauspiciousness.

slokas.sanskrit: कर्मणो ह्यपि बोद्धव्यं बोद्धव्यं च विकर्मणः | अकर्मणश्च बोद्धव्यं गहना कर्मणो गतिः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
karmaṇo hy api boddhavyaṁ boddhavyaṁ ca vikarmaṇaḥ
akarmaṇaś ca boddhavyaṁ gahanā karmaṇo gatiḥ
slokas.meaning: The intricacies of action are very hard to understand. Therefore, one should understand what proper action, forbidden action, and inaction are.

slokas.sanskrit: कर्मण्यकर्म यः पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म यः | स बुद्धिमान्मनुष्येषु स युक्तः कृत्स्नकर्मकृत् ||
slokas.pronunciation:
karmaṇy akarma yaḥ paśyed akarmaṇi ca karma yaḥ
sa buddhimān manuṣyeṣu sa yuktaḥ kṛtsna-karma-kṛt
slokas.meaning: One who sees inaction in action, and action in inaction, is intelligent among humans and is in the transcendental position, although engaged in all activities.

slokas.sanskrit: यस्य सर्वे समारम्भाः कामसङ्कल्पवर्जिताः | ज्ञानाग्निदग्धकर्माणं तमाहुः पण्डितं बुधाः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
yasya sarve samārambhāḥ kāma-saṅkalpa-varjitāḥ
jñānāgni-dagdha-karmāṇaṁ tam āhuḥ paṇḍitaṁ budhāḥ
slokas.meaning: One whose actions are free from desire and selfish motives, and whose actions are burnt up by the fire of knowledge, is called a wise person by the learned.

slokas.sanskrit: त्यक्त्वा कर्मफलासङ्गं नित्यतृप्तो निराश्रयः | कर्मण्यभिप्रवृत्तोऽपि नैव किञ्चित्करोति सः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
tyaktvā karma-phala-āsaṅgaṁ nitya-tṛpto nirāśrayaḥ
karmaṇy abhipravṛtto ’pi naiva kiñcit karoti saḥ
slokas.meaning: Abandoning attachment to the fruits of actions, ever content, and dependent on no one, a person, though engaged in action, does nothing at all.

slokas.sanskrit: निर्गतद्वेषरागः क्षीयमानकलेवरः | नैष्कर्म्यसिद्धिं पुरुषो लभते नैव सूच्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation:
nirgata-dveṣa-rāgaḥ kṣīyamāna-kalevaraḥ
naiṣkarmya-siddhiṁ puruṣo labhate naiva sūcyate
slokas.meaning: One devoid of attachment, free from aversion, and whose body is under control, attains perfection through inaction while being unaffected by any outcome.

slokas.sanskrit: यदृच्छालाभसन्तुष्टो द्वन्द्वातीतो विमत्सरः | समः सिद्धावसिद्धौ च कृत्वापि न निबध्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation:
yadṛcchā-lābha-santuṣṭo dvandvātīto vimatsaraḥ
samaḥ siddhāv asiddhau ca kṛtvāpi na nibadhyate
slokas.meaning: Satisfied with whatever comes unasked, transcending dualities, free from envy, and balanced in success and failure, such a person is not bound by actions.

slokas.sanskrit: गतसङ्गस्य मुक्तस्य ज्ञानावस्थितचेतसः | यज्ञायाचरतः कर्म समग्रं प्रविलीयते ||
slokas.pronunciation:
gata-saṅgasya muktasya jñānāvasthita-cetasaḥ
yajñāyācarataḥ karma samagraṁ pravilīyate
slokas.meaning: For one who is free from attachment, liberated, whose mind is established in knowledge, and who acts for the sake of sacrifice, all actions are completely dissolved.

slokas.sanskrit: ब्रह्मार्पणं ब्रह्म हविर्ब्रह्माग्नौ ब्रह्मणा हुतम् | ब्रह्मैव तेन गन्तव्यं ब्रह्मकर्मसमाधिना ||
slokas.pronunciation:
brahmārpaṇaṁ brahma havir brahmāgnau brahmaṇā hutam
brahmaiva tena gantavyaṁ brahma-karma-samādhinā
slokas.meaning: The act of offering is Brahman; the oblation is Brahman; it is offered by Brahman in the fire of Brahman. One who is absorbed in this consciousness attains Brahman alone.

slokas.sanskrit: दैवमेवापरे यज्ञं योगिनः पर्युपासते | ब्रह्माग्नावपरे यज्ञं यज्ञेनैवोपजुह्वति ||
slokas.pronunciation:
daivam evāpare yajñaṁ yoginaḥ paryupāsate
brahmāgnāv apare yajñaṁ yajñenaivopajuhvati
slokas.meaning: Some yogis worship the gods through sacrifices, while others offer the self as sacrifice in the fire of Brahman itself.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रोत्रादीनीन्द्रियाण्यन्ये संयमाग्निषु जुह्वति | शब्दादीन्विषयानन्य इन्द्रियाग्निषु जुह्वति ||
slokas.pronunciation:
śrotrādīnīndriyāṇy anye saṁyamāgniṣu juhvati
śabdādīn viṣayān anya indriyāgniṣu juhvati
slokas.meaning: Some offer the functions of their senses and their life-energy into the fire of self-control, while others offer sound and other objects of the senses into the fire of the senses.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वाणीन्द्रियकर्माणि प्राणकर्माणि चापरे | आत्मसंयमयोगाग्नौ जुह्वति ज्ञानदीपिते ||
slokas.pronunciation:
sarvāṇīndriya-karmāṇi prāṇa-karmāṇi cāpare
ātma-saṁyama-yogāgnau juhvati jñāna-dīpite
slokas.meaning: Others offer all the actions of their senses and vital functions into the fire of self-discipline kindled by knowledge.

slokas.sanskrit: द्रव्ययज्ञास्तपोयज्ञा योगयज्ञास्तथापरे | स्वाध्यायज्ञानयज्ञाश्च यतयः संशितव्रताः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
dravyayajñās tapoyajñā yoga-yajñās tathāpare
svādhyāya-jñāna-yajñāś ca yatayaḥ saṁśita-vratāḥ
slokas.meaning: Some perform sacrifice with material possessions, some through austerity, some practice yoga as a sacrifice, while others offer self-study and knowledge as sacrifice with strict vows.

slokas.sanskrit: अपाने जुह्वति प्राणं प्राणेऽपानं तथापरे | प्राणापानगती रुद्ध्वा प्राणायामपरायणाः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
apāne juhvati prāṇaṁ prāṇe ’pānaṁ tathāpare
prāṇāpāna-gatī ruddhvā prāṇāyāma-parāyaṇāḥ
slokas.meaning: Some offer the incoming breath into the outgoing breath, and the outgoing breath into the incoming breath, practicing breath control and remaining absorbed in the regulation of life-force.

slokas.sanskrit: अपरे नियताहाराः प्राणान्प्राणेषु जुह्वति | सर्वेऽप्येते यज्ञविदो यज्ञक्षपितकल्मषाः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
apare niyatāhārāḥ prāṇān prāṇeṣu juhvati
sarve ’pyete yajña-vido yajña-kṣapita-kalmaṣāḥ
slokas.meaning: Still others, who regulate their diet, offer the functions of all their senses into the life-energy. All these, being knowledgeable in sacrifice, have their sins destroyed by such sacrifices.

slokas.sanskrit: यज्ञशिष्टामृतभुजो यान्ति ब्रह्म सनातनम् | नायं लोकोऽस्त्ययज्ञस्य कुतोऽन्यः कुरुसत्तम ||
slokas.pronunciation:
yajña-śiṣṭāmṛta-bhujo yānti brahma sanātanam
nāyaṁ loko 'sty ayajñasya kuto 'nyaḥ kuru-sattama
slokas.meaning: Those who partake of the remnants of sacrifice attain the eternal Brahman. O best of the Kurus, for those who do not perform sacrifice, even this world is unattainable, let alone the next.

slokas.sanskrit: एवं बहुविधा यज्ञा वितता ब्रह्मणो मुखे | कर्मजान्विद्धि तान्सर्वानेवं ज्ञात्वा विमोक्ष्यसे ||
slokas.pronunciation:
evaṁ bahu-vidhā yajñā vitatā brahmaṇo mukhe
karma-jān viddhi tān sarvān evaṁ jñātvā vimokṣyase
slokas.meaning: All these different kinds of sacrifices have their origin in action. Knowing this, you shall be liberated from bondage to action.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रेयान्द्रव्यमयाद्यज्ञाज्ज्ञानयज्ञः परन्तप | सर्वं कर्माखिलं पार्थ ज्ञाने परिसमाप्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation:
śreyān dravya-mayād yajñāj jñāna-yajñaḥ parantapa
sarvaṁ karmākhilaṁ pārtha jñāne parisamāpyate
slokas.meaning: O Arjuna, the sacrifice of knowledge is superior to the material sacrifice. All actions in their entirety culminate in knowledge.

slokas.sanskrit: तद्विद्धि प्रणिपातेन परिप्रश्नेन सेवया | उपदेक्ष्यन्ति ते ज्ञानं ज्ञानिनस्तत्त्वदर्शिनः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
tad viddhi praṇipātena paripraśnena sevayā
upadekṣyanti te jñānaṁ jñāninas tattva-darśinaḥ
slokas.meaning: Seek knowledge by humbly approaching the wise, questioning them with reverence, and serving them. The enlightened ones will impart knowledge to you, for they have realized the truth.

slokas.sanskrit: यज्ज्ञात्वा न पुनर्मोहमेवं यास्यसि पाण्डव | येन भूतान्यशेषेण द्रक्ष्यस्यात्मन्यथो मयि ||
slokas.pronunciation:
yaj jñātvā na punar mohām evaṁ yāsyasi pāṇḍava
yena bhūtāny aśeṣeṇa drakṣyasy ātman yatho mayi
slokas.meaning: Having obtained that knowledge, you shall never fall again into delusion. By it, you will see all living beings within yourself and also within Me.

slokas.sanskrit: अपि चेदसि पापेभ्यः सर्वेभ्यः पापकृत्तमः | सर्वं ज्ञानप्लवेनैव वृजिनं सन्तरिष्यसि ||
slokas.pronunciation:
api ced asi pāpebhyaḥ sarvebhyaḥ pāpa-kṛttamaḥ
sarvaṁ jñāna-plavenaiva vṛjinaṁ santariṣyasi
slokas.meaning: Even if you are the most sinful of all sinners, you will cross over all sin by the raft of knowledge.

slokas.sanskrit: यथैधांसि समिद्धोऽग्निर्भस्मसात्कुरुतेऽर्जुन | ज्ञानाग्निः सर्वकर्माणि भस्मसात्कुरुते तथा ||
slokas.pronunciation:
yathaidhāṁsi samiddho 'gnir bhasmasāt kurute ’rjuna
jñānāgniḥ sarva-karmāṇi bhasmasāt kurute tathā
slokas.meaning: Just as a blazing fire reduces wood to ashes, O Arjuna, so does the fire of knowledge burn all karma to ashes.

slokas.sanskrit: न हि ज्ञानेन सदृशं पवित्रमिह विद्यते | तत्स्वयं योगसंसिद्धः कालेनात्मनि विन्दति ||
slokas.pronunciation:
na hi jñānena sadṛśaṁ pavitram iha vidyate
tat svayaṁ yoga-saṁsiddhaḥ kālenātmani vindati
slokas.meaning: Certainly, there is no purifier in this world like knowledge. One who is perfected in yoga finds it within himself in due course of time.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रद्धावान्लभते ज्ञानं तत्परः संयतेन्द्रियः | ज्ञानं लब्ध्वा परां शान्तिमचिरेणाधिगच्छति ||
slokas.pronunciation:
śraddhāvān labhate jñānaṁ tat-paraḥ saṁyatendriyaḥ
jñānaṁ labdhvā parāṁ śāntim acireṇādhigacchati
slokas.meaning: The faithful, devoted to knowledge, and having mastery over the senses, quickly attains supreme peace after acquiring knowledge.

slokas.sanskrit: अज्ञश्चाश्रद्दधानश्च संशयात्मा विनश्यति | नायं लोकोऽस्ति न परो न सुखं संशयात्मनः ||
slokas.pronunciation:
ajñaś cāśraddadhānaś ca saṁśayātmā vinaśyati
nāyaṁ loko ’sti na paro na sukhaṁ saṁśayātmanaḥ
slokas.meaning: The ignorant, the faithless, and the doubting soul perish. For the doubting soul, there is neither this world nor the next, nor happiness.

slokas.sanskrit: योगसंन्यस्तकर्माणं ज्ञानसञ्छिन्नसंशयम् | आत्मवन्तं न कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय ||
slokas.pronunciation:
yoga-saṁnyasta-karmāṇaṁ jñāna-saṁchinna-saṁśayam
ātmavantaṁ na karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjaya
slokas.meaning: One whose actions are renounced in yoga, whose doubts are dispelled by knowledge, and who is self-possessed, is not bound by actions, O Arjuna.

slokas.sanskrit: तस्मादज्ञानसम्भूतं हृत्स्थं ज्ञानासिनात्मनः | छित्त्वैनं संशयं योगमातिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ भारत ||
slokas.pronunciation:
tasmād ajñāna-sambhūtaṁ hṛt-sthaṁ jñānāsinātmanaḥ
chittvainam saṁśayaṁ yogam ātiṣṭho ’tiṣṭha bhārata
slokas.meaning: Therefore, with the sword of knowledge, cut asunder the doubt born of ignorance in your heart. Take refuge in yoga and arise, O Bharata.
